page.title: 18Local History
page.content: The whole of the area abounds in history. We find traces of Stone Age man, Bronze Age man and the Romans. The Danes settled at Danesford, and the Saxons lived along the river's edge, near to where the town lies now. The Normans built a huge castle, around which the town of 'Brugge' now Bridgnorth grew up.After the castle was destroyed during the Civil War, the town fell into a bad state and may have almost disappeared had not the Industrial Revolution begun a few miles upstream at Ironbridge. Bridgnorth took on a new lease of life as a major inland port. The huge special boats called Trows which used the river, carried raw materials up and finished goods down the river, and on out to sea and around to London docks.
